title: Student crashes on way home from Halloween party and medics think she’s dead
text:
Student Sidney Wolfe crashed her car while covered in fake blood (Picture: @SidwWolfe)

Paramedics feared the worst when they arrived at a car crash and discovered the driver covered head-to-toe in blood.

In fact, student Sidney Wolfe totalled her car while on the way home from a Halloween party.

The blood she was covered in was fake as she was dressed as Carrie from the Stephen King novel and movie by the same name.

Earlier in the night she had been promoting a local theatre production of a musical version of Carrie.

Sidney was in a white dress, tiara, and a gallon of fake blood when she crashed her car, convincing first responders she was dead.

Sidney, from West Virginia, US, tweeted about the crash and said: ‘If anyone wants to know how my weekend went I totalled my car while dressed up as Carrie and everyone who was a first responder thought I was dead HAHAHAHA IM SO SORRY.’

Sidney was dressed as Carrie – the Stephen King character – to promote a musical version of the horror story (Picture: @SidwWolfe)

The wreck of her car (Picture: @SidwWolfe)

She also posted pictures of herself, with the red paint dripping down her face and smeared on her chest.

Advertisement

Advertisement

It had soaked much of her white dress and plastered her hair.

She explained she crashed when a deer ran in front of her car and said she was ‘very lucky’ to walk away with just a bruise on her leg.

Sidney added: ‘It’s just funny because I looked terrible. God was looking out for me.’

She said: ‘I was promoting Carrie the Musical at a haunted house. At the end of the night, I was too tired to shower and remove my makeup so when I wrecked the first responders saw my blood and freaked.

‘I risked my life to promote this musical.’

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
